GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles

queries.description: filters the articles by the topic value specified in the query. If the query is omitted, responds with all articles
sorts the articles by any valid column (defaults to created_at)
can be set for ascending or descending (defaults to desc)

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an object of the given article id. It should also include comment_count property, which is the total count of all the comments with this article_id (equals to 0, if the article has no comments)

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates the article given by id. Accepts an object in the form: {inc_votes: newVote}. newVote will indicate how much the votes property in the database should be updated by

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Gets all comments for a specific article

exampleResponse.body: Oh, I've got compassion running out of my nose..
exampleResponse.author: jessjelly

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Posts a new comment to an article

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes the comment by given id and responds with 204 and no content

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users

GET /api/users/:username.description: serves a user object of the given username
